name: GetDiscountTemplateByID
description: Get DiscountTemplate by the given ID
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `DiscountTemplates:View`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

BW.name: DateTimeValue
BW.description: Used for datatype DateTime and Date

BW.name: NumberValue
BW.description: Used for datatype Integer and Decimal

BW.name: StringValue
BW.description: Used for datatype String, Text and Enum

DL.name: Code
DL.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

DL.name: Message
DL.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

DL.name: RequestID
DL.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

DL.name: Type
DL.description: A short description of the error type.

DM.name: ExternalIDs
DM.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

DM.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
DM.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

DM.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
DM.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
